snippet: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, on trial in the 2013 bombings at the Boston Marathon, “wanted to punish America,” the prosecutor said during his closing statement.
abstract: Prosecution and defense offer final arguments in Boston Marathon bombing trial of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev; prosecution deploys dramatic, 80-minute multimedia presentation that seeks to portray Tsarnaev as an equal partner in the carnage with his older brother Tamerlan; defense takes opposite course, arguing that Tsarnaev was deeply under his brother's influence.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

lead_paragraph: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, on trial in the 2013 bombings at the Boston Marathon, “wanted to punish America,” the prosecutor said during his closing statement.

headline.main: Boston Marathon Bombing Trial Wraps Up With Clashing Portraits of Naïveté and Extremism
headline.print_headline: Boston Bombing Trial Wraps Up With Clashing Portraits of Naïveté and Extremism
